references.paper_title: Causal discovery in heterogeneous environments under the sparse mechanism shift hypothesis
references.reason: This paper introduces a novel perspective on causal discovery under distribution shifts, which is the core focus of the main paper.

references.paper_title: Temporal quality degradation in AI models
references.reason: This paper highlights the common real-world issue of temporal distribution shifts impacting AI model performance, providing a key context for the research.

references.paper_title: Wild-time: A benchmark of in-the-wild distribution shift over time
references.reason: This paper introduces the Wild-Time benchmark, a crucial dataset used for evaluating the proposed model's performance in the main paper.
This paper lays the theoretical foundation for the Prior-Data Fitted Networks (PFNs), which the main paper builds upon.

references.paper_title: TabPFN: A transformer that solves small tabular classification problems in a second
references.reason: This paper introduces TabPFN, the foundational model that the main paper extends and improves upon.
